title: ‘Jeopardy!’ featured a Massachusetts colleges category. Can you run the table?
author: John Waller
bullets: 'Jeopardy!' featured a 'Schooling You in Massachusetts' category on the 'Tournament of Champions.'
Questions ranged from $400 to $2,000, with topics on Smith, Amherst, Brandeis, Northeastern, and Mount Holyoke.
Contestants did not answer the $1,200 question about Brandeis University in Waltham.

title: ‘May the best team win’: Tom Brady’s evasive answer regarding his Super Bowl LX rooting interest
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Tom Brady expressed neutrality regarding Super Bowl LX, stating 'may the best team win' without supporting the Patriots or Seahawks.
In a podcast interview, Brady emphasized rooting for people he knows and recognized the Patriots' new chapter under Mike Vrabel.
Brady's own NFL rankings didn't consistently place Patriots or Seahawks as top teams during the season, adding context to his neutrality.

title: Got an ice dam? Here’s what to do.
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Ice dams form when melting snow refreezes at a roof's edge, potentially causing water damage to homes.
Prevention includes removing roof snow with a plastic rake, and improving attic insulation and ventilation.
Professional steaming is recommended for ice dam removal; avoid using salt to prevent interior water damage.

title: Trump is said to have dropped demand for cash from Harvard
author: New York Times Service
bullets: President Trump dropped the demand for Harvard to pay $200 million, seeking resolution of conflicts with the university.
Trump later claimed he was seeking $1 billion in damages from Harvard, shifting towards criminal investigations.
Harvard relies on federal funding and is considering its options amid Trump's ongoing control campaign over education.

title: We can’t wait to watch these movies and TV shows in 2026
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Robert Pattinson and Zendaya star in 'The Drama,' a film about a couple facing a life-altering secret.
'Paradise' Season 2 and 'Survivor 50' are among the anticipated TV premieres in 2026.
Christopher Nolan adapts 'The Odyssey' with Matt Damon as Odysseus, scheduled for release on July 17, 2026.

title: Report: Patriots owner Robert Kraft not selected for 2026 Pro Football Hall of Fame class
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Robert Kraft was a first-time finalist for the Pro Football Hall of Fame Class of 2026 but was not selected.
Kraft needed 40 out of 50 votes from the selection committee to be inducted, but failed to reach the threshold.
Kraft, owner of the Patriots since 1994, contributed to six Super Bowl victories and improved team performance significantly.

title: Forget the refs. Bruins only have themselves to blame after collapse in Tampa.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins squandered a 5-1 lead to lose 6-5 in a shootout against Tampa Bay Lightning.
Bruins incurred multiple penalties, allowing Tampa to capitalize with power-play goals, including two 5-on-3 tallies.
Boston leads the NHL in penalty minutes per game, which contributed to their defensive struggles and loss.

title: How NFL commissioner Roger Goodell reacted to reported Bill Belichick Hall of Fame snub
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell stated the league has no influence over the Pro Football Hall of Fame voting process.
Bill Belichick did not receive enough votes for induction into the Hall of Fame in 2026, missing by 10 votes.
Belichick's exclusion prompted reactions from athletes, questioning the omission of the coach with a record six Super Bowl wins.

title: North Andover’s Jake Bobo ready to play ‘bad guy’ against hometown Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jake Bobo, a North Andover native and Seahawks receiver, will face the Patriots in Super Bowl LX.
Bobo, in his third season with Seattle, recently contributed a 17-yard touchdown in the NFC Championship.
Despite his New England roots, Bobo aims to thwart the Patriots' hopes for another championship parade.

title: 10 Patriots takeaways from Super Bowl Opening Night
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots quarterback Drake Maye reported he is feeling good despite prior shoulder and illness concerns ahead of Super Bowl LX.
Head coach Mike Vrabel received praise from players for his leadership, helping Patriots reach the Super Bowl.
Patriots players expressed excitement for Super Bowl halftime performer Bad Bunny, highlighting his influence on Latino youth.
